subject: Gardening
title: The High Line: Ruin to Garden
description: A quick, practical guide to The High Line: Ruin to Garden.

hook.text: An abandoned elevated railway in Manhattan was scheduled for demolition. Now it's a world-famous garden.

buildup.text: The High Line freight rail stopped running in 1980. Wild plants slowly colonized the tracks for 20 years.

discovery.text: Piet Oudolf designed the new planting to echo those wild volunteersâ€”a designed garden that looks undesigned.

twist.text: Opening in 2009, the High Line transformed surrounding neighborhoods. Property values soared. Gentrification followed.

climax.text: The High Line inspired 'rails to trails' projects worldwideâ€”proving that ruins can become the best public gardens.

punchline.text: New York's wildest garden grows on old train tracks.

quiz.question: What was the High Line before it became a public garden?
options: An abandoned elevated freight railway colonized by wild plants
A covered market built during the Great Depression
